intro: Scleria elongatissima, commonly known as the long-stemmed sedges, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and tall, cylindrical flower spikes. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its botanical features include rhizomes that help in vegetative propagation. Scleria elongatissima is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to fluctuating water levels.
